headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Board of Councilmen. ARRESTS AT QUARANTINE. LEAP OF A CRAZY WOMAN. YOUTHFUL BURGLARS Coroner's Inquest. Shall New-York he Disconnected from her Suburbs? BOLD ROBBERY. Police Intelllgence. ATTEMPTED RAPE. THE LATE MURDEROUS ASSAULT IN THE FOURTH WARD--John L Gafney,who was so brutally as WIFE STABBING.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Councilmen met Thursday afternoon, the President, C. H. HASWELL, Esq, in the Chair. Councilman BRADY presented a petition from William H. Raynor and others, owners of property on Forty-fourth-street, between Sixth-avenue and Broadway, asking that there streets might be paved with Belgian pavement. Referred to the Committee on Streets.

docs.snippet: THE HEALTH OF THE CITY.-The greatest danger to the public health is during the hot month of August, upon which we are now about to enter. Happily for the welfare of New-York, which could ill afford the disaster of an epidemic just after the terrible...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE HEALTH OF THE CITY.-The greatest danger to the public health is during the hot month of August, upon which we are now about to enter. Happily for the welfare of New-York, which could ill afford the disaster of an epidemic just after the terrible commercial revulsion which we have passed through, the City thus far has been remarkably free from disease.
